body.value:
Sr James's syare 20th March 1724
Mr Ranidal Nicoll
Por I desire you'l call upon me here to morner morning
betveen mine & teno Mh Cook I am Gooyo &
Lendin 25th March 1724
MmmeadSor
I desire you'l hansfer over to Mr James marye one
thousand pounds Capt African Stock, which hi'll be at the African House
to morter at 12, 0th Clock to receive & that you'l likewise sell 1000
African more & enedit my ket therewith the produce thereof & ams
For yo
Lendon 23h Manch 1724
Drr Marges
I have wnote to M Mead to tansfer to you the
1000 Afr St. I desired you to sell & M Collicooe will wis wait upen
you in the Affernoon to deliver, you the acct signed & to take up the
Vouchers
Pust Sor
Your very humble Servt
vr Payne (of Burdgevater) Lenden March 27th 1724
I have just received your Letter but have not time to
answer the particulars of it which I shall not fail to do in a post
At present I can only say in general that I am very
on two
much surprised the Charge of the Buildings at Buydgewates should
gheals
so exceed the Asstimate you sent me atfirst & therefore
must desire you'l send me out of hand an acct Debtor & Creditor
hen you have disposed of the money for which you have already
addwn on me. I would not have you make any further
Drafton me till you have dene this for if you it shall come
protested
I am sor yo

1
Cannons March 28th 1724
Mr Pescod
Sir
I have pstaced the Favour of youns with the setter to
the Duke of Boulton returned. Since my last to you I have
seen a Gentleman from him who has myde a propssal in his Behalf
to me which I would be glad to know your opinion upon. He tells
me my Lord hath an Estate at Kingscleas of between 4 & 500 £ pann
upon which all the Lives are fallen in & which he offers me to fill
up being willing to allow the Debt he owes me as a part of the Fire
I desire you'l be sokind as to speak to Nor Cnoss to let me know
what is ftts neal value and inform me what theee dives in it may
be wouth for if I can have it at a reasonable Rate, I shall be willing
to make this punchase it being a means of considerably encceasing
my Rental & which seems to be the most likly method to get the
Duke out of my Debt. I am Sor  go
Cannons March 28 1724
Mr Payne (of Burdgewattr
Sr
Since, I cam down here I have had an Oppentunity
of looking over your two Letters of the 14th & 22d Inst, and tho I
dont question the Truth of what you say that you have spanddt
no pains to get the Buildings I undertook fnisht agreeable to the
Aistimate yet I confess I cant but be supprised to find they
have proved so mnefectual nor can s imagine why you should have
enlanged the Design of the Warehouse without ffrst of all takeing
my Dinectong upon it on at least without considering whether
such an Enlargement would not paise the Expence to a Degree
the Gent
above wit would yeild when set would produce a Building
Interest for: Apt this has hapned to be very much the Case for
by the acct you have sent me (& in which by the byg it does not
appear to me whether the wholes Expenceis contained or not
the sum already laid out upon it amounts to 771S you
ot the wantouse
say you canet i at 100 pann, so that after that nate I shall
reclive but 42& a year for near 8000 which is not sto0
I must therefore as I acquainted you in
for my Money
my

my last rehern back the Bill protested if it comes to my Hands which
you have drown for the p00S being determined not to pay any more
till I see what the acct of the whole amounts to be how it has been
laid out, in order to which I desire you'l send me up as soon as
your Leisure will permit you andentine acct of the whole Expence
debiting your self with what you have received & taking Credit
for the several payments you have made ranging them under their
Proper Heads, &lz Offacct of the Warehouse, On acct of the
House & on acct of such other Corks as penhaps propenly
beling to neither of these: and you'l add at the Foot of it wc
you judge will be stise wanting to compleat the whole. Such an
acct as this will be abundently more satisfactory the to have
hd it it up ad I have had it hitherto dine.Mr onepant
of it, & another Month another pant of it by which means
I can makeneither Head now Pail of it noe be at a centainty
when these will be an Ond either of the Cork on Charge
What you propose in relation to building a Row of
little Honser where the wall now stands & fill up the moat for
little Gandens to en I believe may tuen very well to Accto: but
I find Sr Thomas Hales does not care to Pant with the Pastre
Ground( adjoyning to it so that I must make the most I can of
what I have salready
I understand there are some of the Houses which are
already built upon this Ground that have not cost near 300 £
& yet are very good ones, now can I conceive how mine should
lost more unless it can be made appear that they are better built
& will set at a better Rent. I am
Sor
To
P:S: Wotwhthstanding what I have wrote about the
Rent of the Waretoud, I dent mean thereby that I would not
have you set the 3 for the Rent you mention for I think it
is better to take that than to have it lye empty & get nothing
by it
